Authors:
Tsutomu Hattori, Kozue Sotome, Yuko Ota, BEE-KIN THI, See S
Lee, Baharuddin Salleh
Title:
Postia stellifera sp. nov., a stipitate and terrestrial
polypore from Malaysia
Abstract:
Postia stellifera sp. nov. is described from Malaysia.
This fungus is characterized by the distinctly stipitate basidiomata,
terrestrial habit and verrucose chlamydospores both in the context and
the in the culture. Its macromorphology is similar to Albatrellus spp.,
but phylogenetic analysis based on LSU revealed that it is placed within
a clade consisting of Postia, Amylocystis and Jahnoporus where all
species have white and fleshy to soft corky context and monomitic hyphal
system with clamped generative hyphae. Most sequences showing high
homology with P. stellifera are those of brown rot polypores.
